intro: Pulassarium thyrsiflorum, commonly known as the golden star bush, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its compact shrub form with dense foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the spring. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. Pulassarium thyrsiflorum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
